title: Landlord Trying to Evict Illegally
description: When your landlord attempts to evict you without proper legal procedures, notice, or valid grounds

rights.title: Right to Adequate Notice Period
rights.description: Tenants have the right to receive proper written notice before eviction as per rental agreement or state law

rights.title: Right to Legal Due Process
rights.description: Landlords cannot forcibly evict tenants without court orders and proper legal procedures

rights.title: Right to Peaceful Possession
rights.description: Right to continue living in rented property until lawful eviction through proper channels

actionSteps.title: Document All Communications
actionSteps.description: Keep records of all notices, messages, and communications from landlord regarding eviction

actionSteps.title: Review Rental Agreement
actionSteps.description: Examine lease agreement for eviction clauses, notice periods, and grounds for termination

actionSteps.title: Send Legal Response to Landlord
actionSteps.description: Respond to eviction notice challenging its legality and asserting your tenant rights

actionSteps.title: Approach Rent Control Authority
actionSteps.description: File complaint with local rent control authority or housing tribunal if available

actionSteps.title: File Civil Suit if Necessary
actionSteps.description: If illegal eviction continues, file civil suit for injunction and damages

sources.title: Transfer of Property Act, 1882
sources.authority: Legislative Department, Ministry of Law and Justice

sources.title: Tenant Rights and Responsibilities Guide
sources.authority: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
